01-welcome.png.title: Welcome to Mossy
01-welcome.png.description: This is the first screen you see when launching Mossy. The dashboard provides quick access to all modules and shows your current project status.

02-sidebar.png.title: Sidebar Navigation
02-sidebar.png.description: Navigate between different modules using the sidebar. All major sections like The Nexus, Talk to Mossy, Live Voice, and tools are accessible here.

03-nexus-dashboard.png.title: The Nexus Dashboard
03-nexus-dashboard.png.description: The Nexus is your central hub showing all available modules. Click any card to jump to that tool or feature.

04-chat-interface.png.title: Chat with Mossy
04-chat-interface.png.description: Ask Mossy questions about Fallout 4 modding. Mossy has knowledge of Papyrus scripting, Creation Kit, xEdit, and more.

05-live-voice.png.title: Live Voice Conversation
05-live-voice.png.description: Talk to Mossy hands-free with Live Voice. Perfect for getting help while working in other applications like Blender or the Creation Kit.

06-auditor.png.title: The Auditor
06-auditor.png.description: Analyze your mod files with The Auditor. It checks ESP, NIF, and DDS files for common issues and performance problems.

07-image-suite.png.title: Image Suite
07-image-suite.png.description: Generate PBR textures automatically. Create normal maps, roughness maps, height maps, and more from your base textures.

08-workshop.png.title: The Workshop
08-workshop.png.description: Write and compile Papyrus scripts in The Workshop. Features syntax highlighting, code snippets, and direct compilation.

09-vault.png.title: The Vault
09-vault.png.description: Manage your mod assets in The Vault. Browse files, view metadata, and organize your resources.

10-bridge.png.title: Desktop Bridge
10-bridge.png.description: Desktop Bridge detects your installed modding tools. Connect Blender, xEdit, NifSkope, and other programs for integrated workflows.

11-settings.png.title: Settings & Configuration
11-settings.png.description: Configure Mossy's AI, voice settings, tool paths, and privacy preferences. All settings are stored locally on your computer.

12-help.png.title: Documentation & Help
12-help.png.description: Access comprehensive guides, tutorials, and reference documentation for Fallout 4 modding techniques.
